intro: Gibasis karwinskyana, commonly known as the Karwinsky's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features showy yellow flowers surrounded by green bracts, and it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
